Title: Manufacturing Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
Develops and improves the manufacturing process by studying people, product, and manufacturing methods.
Role and Responsibilities
Identify opportunities and assume full ownership for increasing production rates, minimizing equipment downtime and reducing labour costs.
Expected to assume a leading role in driving lean manufacturing initiatives (including but not limited to 5S, Value Stream Mapping, Six Sigma) as well as continuous improvement initiatives (EVA increase, Scrap Decrease, centerline implementation) in conjunction with the continuous improvement engineer.
Define objectives and expected benefits, develop Kaizen teams, manage execution timelines and quantify results.
Expected to assume a role in capital projects associated with building / facility improvements, customer-driven CIP’s, regulatory compliance (i.e. electrical, fire, safety), operational costs savings.
Prepare costs justifications, track, and conform to identified budgetary constraints, coordinate functions and scheduling for all internal and external resources.
Conduct line trials, in conjunction with production and maintenance, conforming to all customer requirements associated with pilots, line validations and product stability.
Maintain constant communication with CIC’s customer representatives and operations group with regards to new launches, packaging changes, line trials, operational issues.
Develop change controls associated with all internal products transfers, new equipment installations and process changes
Develops routings for main and alternate lines associated with all new and internally transferred products. Issue line setup sheets, populate /update routing database.
Work with in-house personnel and outside vendors to develop change parts for all new and internally transferred products.
Develop the necessary execution timelines, capturing all requirements pertaining to mechanical/electrical installation, testing, personnel training, and validation.
Provides hand-on support on production lines (PLC, trouble shooting, component changes/approvals, process flow/crew optimizations etc.)
Conduct Plant tours as required.
Daily coordination, in conjunction with maintenance, identifying and resolving scheduling conflicts, stipulating completion expectations, reviewing failures and executing corrective actions
Hands-on involvement with a feasible number of changeovers.
Work with in-house personnel and outside vendors to develop methods facilitating rapid changeovers (i.e. Q-release handles, standardized tools, dowel pinning, etc.).
Benchmark with other manufacturing centers and apply World Class practices to Voyant’s environment.
Ensure full compliance with all Voyant’s safety guidelines, as pertaining to external contractors.
Other duties as required.
Qualifications and Education Requirements
Engineering Degree (Industrial, Mechanical or Chemical)
Minimum 3-5 years in manufacturing (preferably in personal care, pharmaceutical, or food processing)
Experience with lean manufacturing & continuous improvement
Strong communication skills, (verbal and written)
CAD, MS Office (Access, Excel), Minitab
Strong project management skills
Voyant Beauty provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, disability or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Voyant Beauty complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training

Title: Mechanical Engineer Intern - London, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you interested in being part of an innovative team that supports Westinghouse’s mission to provide clean energy solutions? At Westinghouse, we recognize that our employees are our most valuable asset and we seek to identify, attract and recruit the most qualified talent while recognizing and encouraging the value of diversity in the global workplace.
Mechanical Engineer Intern - London, Canada
Your day to day:
You will work closely with the guidance and supervision as a team member on tasks and projects under the guidance of a Senior Engineer/Designer in both Nuclear and infrastructure (Non-Nuclear) with private clients, municipalities, healthcare, and academic establishments. Your opportunity will include;
Assist in the design of new or revised products, equipment, installations, or processes for building services (HVAC, plumbing drainage etc.), using established engineering principles to meet functional requirements or performance specifications.
Handle design problems of moderate complexity using a variety of standard engineering methods/techniques.
Perform preliminary engineering calculations, produce detailed drawings
Prepare bills of materials, specify or evaluate appropriate purchased components
Review of designs and drawings for accuracy, material selection, manufacturability.
Expand your knowledge of material properties and the behaviour of materials and structures under multiple load combinations.
Participate in key customer projects from conception to execution alongside intermediate and senior engineers. This is a terrific opportunity to support several exciting local projects.
Site visits or field work where required.
Perform field work (evaluation of existing sites) as directed by senior engineer/designer.
Participate in mechanical design including ductwork, building load calculations and equipment layouts.
Assist with engineering duties on projects of various degrees of complexity.
Productions of CAD and/or Revit drawings
Assists in handling assignments of limited scope or complexity within the mechanical department.
May modify systems applications, designs, or prototypes to permit economical manufacturing, or meet performance specifications
You you are:
Working towards a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or Equivalent.
Will be required to consultative and communication abilities to confer with others (mainly internally), gather information and present analyses
Typical office environment working with computer and remaining sedentary for long periods of time
You will also have the opportunity to take part in the Westinghouse Culture and as an intern take part in specific events such as:
Virtual Kick Off Event: which is an opportunity for you to meet your peers and will feature a keynote address by a member of the Westinghouse executive leadership team.
Networking Events: During your time with Westinghouse, you will have access to numerous virtual networking and team building opportunities that will assist you in developing and cultivating superior interpersonal skills, and long-lasting relationship.
Virtual Coffee Breaks with Executives: You will have access to numerous weekly virtual coffee breaks with the Westinghouse Executives. These weekly sessions will be centered around an assortment of topics where you are encouraged to ask questions and gain insight.
Why Westinghouse?
Westinghouse Electric Company is the global nuclear energy industry’s first choice for safe, clean, and efficient energy solutions. We enable our delivery of this vision by living our value system:
Safety and Quality
Integrity and Trust
Customer Focus and Innovation
Speed and Passion to Win
Teamwork and Accountability
Westinghouse offers competitive benefits to all our employees around the globe to keep them healthy and enhance their well-being. In the U.S. the following are representative of what we offer:
Competitive Salary
Comprehensive Health, Wellness and Income Protection Benefits
401(k) Savings Plan with Company Match
Paid Vacations and Holidays
Opportunities for Flexible Work Arrangements
Educational Reimbursement Program
Employee Referral Program
While our Global Headquarters are located in Cranberry Township, PA, we have over 9,000 employees working at locations in 19 different countries. You can learn more by visiting http://www.westinghousenuclear.com.
EOE of Minorities / Females / Vets / Disability.

Title: New Grad: Optical Measurements Engineer - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Since 1992, Ciena has been driven by a relentless pursuit of network innovation. We believe in a network that grows smarter, more agile, and more responsive every day. This means that when you digitally interact in your world - picking up the phone, streaming video, texting a friend or loved one – your interactions are being enabled by Ciena technologies. Ciena makes your social / entertainment / business existence REAL.
.
Posting Title: Optical Measurements Engineer
What will you do at Ciena?
Ciena is recognized as a leading supplier of state-of-the-art fiber optic transmission technology, and an important aspect of this development is lab work. Join the WaveLogic Science team and leverage our advanced research lab capabilities to experimentally verify new digital signal processing (DSP) algorithms and hardware designs for next generation high-speed optical systems.
Responsibilities
Design and run experiments to evaluate DSP algorithms and hardware for next-generation high-speed optical communication systems.
Analyze, document, communicate, and present the results from complex experiments and large data sets.
Support other Ciena teams through automation and analysis of optical experiments.
General Activities
Create innovative solutions for experimental issues.
Automate, analyze, and visualize experimental data in MATLAB.
Create and perform simulations of experiments then validate predictions via measurement.
Analyze problems in your specific areas of knowledge, which would be a subset of: optical physics, communications theory, probability, and high-speed/RF electronics.
Independently plan and schedule work.
Test at 800 Gb/s and beyond in the lab.
Advanced technology demonstrations for customers.
Collaboration with stakeholders
Interface and collaborate on technical designs with DSP, hardware, firmware, electro-optic, and systems teams.
Share expertise and best practices with lab teams.
Areas of impact
Key technologies to enable state-of-the-art DWDM optical transport development.
Experience
Post-graduate degree in Math, Physics, or Engineering with focus on optical physics, DSP, or communications.
Must have experience working in a lab environment with optical and/or RF technologies.
Must have MATLAB experience.
Python experience is an asset.
LI-CN
About Ciena
Ciena is a network strategy and technology company with a passion to provide an experience, to you and our customers that is as rewarding as the
outcome. We
attract the best and brightest– those with outstanding talent, motivation, and the right attitude to contribute to our success. Our culture balances our openness and informality with professionalism and trust and is built on the foundation of our core values: Customer First, Integrity, Velocity, Innovation, and Outstanding People.
Ciena enables everyone to have a voice and a network that supports them while on the journey to discovering their passion and purpose. We trust each individual to do what they can to reach their full potential and make an impact on the business, whenever, wherever they are in the
world. With
Ciena’s highly innovative, forward-thinking
business practices,
we reward people for pushing the
boundaries. Unlock
your potential at Ciena!
Being You @ Ciena
As part of our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we want to foster an environment that values and respects all individual’s strengths, perspectives, ideas, and ability to meet the needs of our customers globally. Ciena values the diversity of its workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran or marital status or any other category protected by applicable law. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.
Ciena is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration
status.
If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific accommodation
measures required for you
to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.

Title: Engineer in Training - Building Restoration Group - Barrie, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
At Burnside the difference is our people. Our employees are our greatest asset and by encouraging continuous growth and supporting personal development our organization benefits from the increased skill and leadership capacity that results.
We have an exciting opportunity for an Engineer in Training to join our Building Restoration Group working out of our Barrie office. This position will serve existing and future clients in Barrie, Collingwood, and the northern GTA market.
As an Engineer in Training within our Building Restoration group, you will be assisting our team in providing high quality, engineering solutions to meet our clients needs. Typical projects can include concrete and masonry restoration, roof replacement, building condition evaluations, and capital planning.
This is a fantastic opportunity to develop in a career in building sciences by joining a dynamic team that takes on challenging projects and provides excellent rewards and benefits in return.
The Role
The position involves providing assistance to Project Managers, Professional Engineers and technical staff within the Barrie office and other offices on a variety of projects.
More specifically, the position will involve carrying out the following duties:
Assist with Building Restoration projects including site inspections, report writing and design calculations;
Coordinate project parameters with clients as directed by a senior engineer;
Assist with preparation of proposals;
Prepare contract drawing/specifications; and
Other duties as assigned.
Professional Knowledge & Qualifications
We are considering applications from candidates with:
Bachelor of Engineering or Applied Science degree or related field
Exposure to Building Science (e.g. relevant work term or course elective) is preferred but is not a requirement
Eligibility for registration with the Professional Engineers of Ontario.
Strong time management and organizational skills
Strong computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel) with demonstrated interest and ability to learn new systems
Qualified candidates should have:
High degree of problem solving and decision-making skills
Strong communication skills (verbal and written)
Excellent interpersonal abilities and willingness to work in a team atmosphere
High personal quality expectations
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Company Profile
Founded in 1970, R.J. Burnside & Associates Limited is a growing values-driven employee‑owned multi‑discipline engineering and environmental consultancy firm with over 350 staff and a proven track record of providing highly responsive service to clients in the Public, Private, Aboriginal and International sectors.
We work on a variety of projects throughout Canada, with nine office locations in Ontario and one in Manitoba. Over the past two decades, we have also been active internationally, with varied and ongoing projects across the Caribbean and Africa.
Burnside has expertise in many technical disciplines beyond traditional civil engineering including air and noise, environmental services, GIS, hydrogeology, land development, renewable energy & conservation, solid waste, structures, transportation, traffic, water/wastewater and well drilling & diagnostics.
We take pride in our people and in our culture and the company has a strong reputation as being a great place to work. We are always interested in speaking with talented people who wish to share their careers with us at any of our offices. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, including RSP Matching Plans, Fitness Benefits, Flexible Hours and Work Locations, Career Development Opportunities, Continuing Education, Social Activities and a positive & inclusive working environment.
We are an equal opportunity employer committed to seeking diversity in the workplace and we welcome resumes from all qualified candidates. Burnside will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the entire recruitment, assessment and selection process, as required. If you are a person with a disability and require an accommodation during these processes, please contact our Human Resources department.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Mechanical Designer - Prince George, BC - Indeed.com

Mechanical Designer
International Quest Engineering Ltd.
is an established engineering company in Prince George, B.C. specializing in structural and mechanical engineering for the Wood Products, Mining and Energy Industries. We are currently looking for a motivated professional wanting a rewarding career as a mechanical designer.
Job Description
This is a growth-oriented position providing the opportunity to play an integral role in a wide range of projects requiring both office and field work. Title: Testing & Commissioning Engineer - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Overview:
A division of VINCI Construction Grands Projets, JANIN ATLAS is an industry leader in the construction of major heavy civil and building projects.
VINCI Construction Grands Projets is itself a subsidiary of VINCI, a world-class leader in construction and concession projects which employs more than 183 000 people in over a hundred countries.
JANIN ATLAS undertakes design-build projects, turn-key projects, as well as more traditional build-only projects, all with a high degree of technical difficulty. We are specialized in the construction of complex projects such as bridges, major highway infrastructures or large-diameter tunnels, all of which require important management and coordination resources.
Our projects are characterized by innovative contractual solutions: Partnerships, ECI
(Early Contractor Involvement), FEED (Front-End Engineering Design)
and EPC
(Engineering, Procurement and Construction)
.
We also offer extensive experience in multiple project financing solutions
(BOT, DBFOT, PPP, Concessions)
.
Project Overview:
The Confederation Line Extension Project - one of the components of the City of Ottawa Stage 2 O-Train system – includes the design, construction and financing of 27,5kilometres of light rail infrastructure. The scope of work also includes 4 kilometers of cut-and cover tunnels, 20 engineered structures, 16 stations and a light maintenance service facility.
When complete, Stage 2 will bring 77 percent of residents within five kilometers of rail transportation. It will greatly enhance the quality of life in Ottawa, contributing to shorter commutes, cleaner air and a stronger economy. It will also help the city prepare for continued growth, with a population that is expected to reach 1.1 million by 2031.
In April 2019, Kiewit-Eurovia-VINCI (KEV) was selected to design, build and finance the project. Construction is anticipated to be complete for the Confederation Line East extension in 2024 and in 2025 for the Confederation Line West extension.
We are looking for a T&C Engineer!
You will do
Principal Accountability & Responsibility:
Expected to have many direct interactions with designers and sub-contractors.
Working with:
Designer / Design Systems Integration
QA/QC Engineers
Systems Assurance Engineers / Coordinators
Construction team
Testing & Commissioning team
Subcontractors / Vendors
Main assignments and activities:
Draft documents related to Testing & Commissioning program (Inspection Test Plan, Test Procedures for functional, performance, Interface and integration tests)
Review the Testing & Commissioning documents prepared by the Vendor / Sub-contractor against project requirements and functional and technical specifications (Test procedures, operation & maintenance manuals, etc.)
Manage, carry out, participates in the Testing & Commissioning activities for the scope he/she is in charge
Witness Tests activities and prepare Test Reports
Assess and validate test report from Vendor / Subcontractor, follow-up and report the progress of the Test activities for the scope he/she in charge
Liaise with the Designer, Vendor / Subcontractor, RAM & Safety/security, Construction, in relation with his/her Test activities
Manage master defect / punch list and ensure all issues recorded during witnessed and executed testing are registered as required by governing process and progressed towards resolution
Perform verification of prerequisite testing and development of testing schedule for commissioning activities
Coordinating with construction to resolve discrepancies
Liaise with the Integration Manager to identify interfaces issues and provide accurate interface fault statements for proper troubleshooting methodologies to be used to resolve the faults; and
Overseeing re-testing, if necessary; and submit certified test reports.
Within the Project team, the T&C Engineer will ensure information is coordinated efficiently & effectively with all project stakeholders.
He/she will assist the T&C Manager in Interface and with stakeholders such as:
Customer
Operator and Maintainer
Authorities Having Jurisdiction
Stakeholders
The position requires Technical Competencies, good communication & presentation skills (in English) and able to work in multi-disciplined and culturally diverse background environments.
You are/have
Minimum of a Bachelor s degree in Civil Engineering
Experience in the construction industry, preferably on large infrastructure projects
Professional Engineer certificate (P.Eng/P.E./C.Eng) or equivalent, an asset
Basic Knowledge in Systems Assurance i.e. Requirement management / RAM / Safety Security
Ability in Technical coordination and interface management
Fluent in English with professional proficiency, French an asset
Why you should join JANIN ATLAS ?
Our focus on employee health and safety, career development, diversity, compensation, and providing youths with professional opportunities - these are the factors that make JANIN ATLAS a choice employer.
If you are interested, I invite you to apply directly here or at
contact@janin.ca.
We're looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Junior Geotechnical Engineer - Stoney Creek, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Your Employer:
Dare to join Englobe
Terraprobe Inc., member of Englobe Corp. is looking for a
Junior Geotechnical Engineer
to join our team at our
STONEY CREEK
office. The candidate will be a member of a team providing scientific consulting services to private industry and government clients. This position will support a wide variety of projects, and the candidate would be working in the
Geotechnical, Materials Testing & Inspection Fields
Group
.
Englobe and Terraprobe, and its more than 2,600 people, are concerned about the environment daily, engage in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.
At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centered management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.
We offer
Annual reimbursement of sports expenses
Opportunities for skills development
Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours
Vehicle mileage expense
Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.
Your Contribution: As a Junior Geotechnical Engineer, you will work in collaboration with the Geotechnical Team.
Reporting to the Project Managers, your main tasks will be to work on projects supplying laboratory testing, inspection/testing services. More specifically, you will:
Assist with the planning and coordination of field work.
Perform field compaction monitoring & testing, concrete and asphalt testing (field and lab), laboratory soils testing (soil moisture content, sieve/hydrometer analysis, Proctor density)
Supervise drilling and excavation contractors for the completion of subsurface investigations.
Take care of logging and sampling of soil samples for further classification and analysis.
Assist in the preparation of geotechnical reports for land development, buildings, transportation and infrastructure, earth retaining structures, slope stability, and
Work both independently and collaboratively with project teams including field personnel, project managers, draft persons and administrative staff using interpersonal and organizational skills to ensure project tasks are completed on time and within budget.
The position requires travel to various sites within South-Central Ontario. The candidate is required to have a valid Ontario driving licence and access to a vehicle.
Your Profile:
Undergraduate university degree in civil engineering.
Must have or be eligible for PEO licensing.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (i.e. word, excel);
Ability to work independently and as a team player in fast paced dynamic environments.
Displays a willingness to learn, accountability, integrity, and problem-solving skills; and,
Excellent written and oral communication skills and interpersonal skills with the public.
Previous working experience related to geotechnical engineering is not required but is considered an asset.
Location: 903 Barton Street,Unit 22, Stoney Creek, ON
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Toronto- Hydraulic Modeler Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The foundation of RVA is built by our core values – quality, employee ownership, financial stability, and integrity. Our commitment to our core values is reflected in our status as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, one of Greater Toronto's Top 2021 Employers, and one of Canada’s Top 2020 Small and Medium Employers. These earned accolades are an integral part of maintaining our stable foundation in a modern and growing workplace. The future of RVA is growing with the culture of today.
Our goal of sustainable growth is reliant on the help of exemplary individuals who share our core values. We are looking for individuals who want to be a part of our culture – a culture where one takes ownership of their work and of their company. We believe that those who take ownership have the potential to achieve greater things and to grow within their company. Do you want to play an active role in your future and that of your company?
Do you aspire to long term professional growth where you can become an owner in a leading established consulting firm? If you answered yes to both questions, then we may have an opportunity that works for you. The Toronto Office has an opening for an Intermediate Hydraulic Modeler Wastewater to join their Municipal team. Duties: • Provide technical support for hydraulic data visualization for municipal, sewer projects and develop models to determine sound solutions.
Analyze detail in the blueprints, maps, and other related drawings and prepare the survey reports. • Design and oversee construction of power and other hydraulic engineering projects for control and use of water, calculates and estimates rates of waterflow. • Assist with proposal development, planning projects and preparation of cost estimates for modelling and associated engineering works. • Work in a team environment on varieties of projects that would include model build and verification (with existing or new models) to assess system performance and use the model to develop solutions and strategies for improvement.
Qualifications:
• Significant expertise in sewer hydraulic modelling (InfoNets and InfoWorks). • Bachelor’s Degree in Hydrogeology, Geological or Civil Engineering from an accredited post-secondary institution. A relevant Post Graduate degree would be considered an asset. • Must be a licensed Engineer within the province of Ontario.
Minimum of 5-7 years progressive experience in the detailed design and project management of wastewater facilities with at least 10 years working in a consulting engineering firm. • Aptitude for meeting schedule and budgets, proposal writing and client development. • Proven capabilities in planning and writing reports and other technical documents. • Possess a strong ability to develop and maintain positive relationships with staff and clients.
Working knowledge of GIS tools. • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office 365. Compensation: R.V. Anderson Associates Limited (RVA) offers a competitive compensation package, with merit-based profit-sharing bonuses, company share ownership opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Diversity, Inclusion, and Accommodations:
At RVA, we are committed to fostering a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. RVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, religion, creed, marital status, disability, or any other protected status. If you require any special accommodations, please advise Human Resources. Any information received relating to accommodations will be treated as confidential.
Come and help us build the future at RVA!

Title: System Engineer - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com

Support integration and certification of internally developed components and third-party products

Experience with technologies such as L2-L7 network protocols, SDN, virtualization, containers, Kubernetes, and distributed computing is highly desirable
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong logical and creative problem-solving skills

Title: Junior Engineer (EIT) - Municipal Infrastucture - Gatineau, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Welcome to a place where people are at the heart of everything we do.
Welcome to people who like people, to brilliant minds, tomorrow’s visionaries, challenge seekers, collaborators, and those with an entrepreneurial spirit in their DNA.
At CIMA+ you’ll find a place where everyone’s ideas and perspectives are welcomed and encouraged, a place where you’ll have many opportunities to learn and develop while working on projects that rally our team together, where you can proudly become a company shareholder.
At CIMA+, we give you the freedom and flexibility to manage your work on your own terms and define what work-life balance means to you.
At the end of the day, we’re proud to be able to say that when you join CIMA+, we’ll welcome you into a place that you can call home.
Mission
The Engineer will be called upon to work within an experienced multidisciplinary team by supporting the project managers responsible for the design of municipal engineering works for projects of various sizes.
They will join the site planning team responsible for a large portfolio of institutional projects (schools and health facilities). Strong growth is expected in this sector over the next few years and could lead to interesting career advancement opportunities.
Primary responsibilities
Monitor and supervise construction site activities;
Carry out the design of stormwater management structures, sewer networks, aqueduct networks and roadways as well as plan excavation and leveling work
Coordinate the technical aspects of the projects with the technical draftsmen, the other disciplines involved, the client and the third parties involved
Prepare technical specifications, tender slips and construction cost estimates
Prepare specific technical studies, feasibility studies and pre-projects
Establishment of the phasing of the work and the timelines for carrying out the work
Profile
Hold a Bachelor's Degree in Civil engineering or equivalent
Member of the l'Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ)
Have completed internships or possess related experience
Ability to maintain good interpersonal relationships and have demonstrated teamwork skills
Attention to detail and to the quality of the design
Fluency in French, both oral and written (English an asset)
Have experience in the design of stormwater management structures (an asset)
Ethics and integrity are fundamental values at CIMA+, and we are looking for people who uphold these principles. We are committed to creating opportunities for all our talents to contribute to the firm’s success, develop and grow, regardless of cultural or other differences. We fully endorse employment equity principles and encourage women, visible minorities, indigenous people, and individuals with disabilities to apply for any position offered at CIMA+. Adaptation measures are provided upon request to facilitate participation in the recruitment process.

Title: Ingénieur(e) mécanique - Saint-Hubert, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Ingénieur(e) mécanique
Description du poste
Conception Boréale est une entreprise dynamique qui possède une vaste expertise en ingénierie et en gestion de projet, notamment dans le secteur industriel et dans les domaines de l’aéronautique et du transport. Nous recherchons un concepteur mécanique qui viendra enrichir l’équipe et qui aura la possibilité de progresser au travers des projets stimulants et diversifiés.
Mandat
Sous la supervision du chef de projet, l'ingénieur mécanique participe activement à toutes les étapes d’un projet de conception de produits, d’équipements et de systèmes mécaniques. Celui-ci sera amené à produire des concepts préliminaires, à produire des calculs d'ingénierie et des analyses, à réaliser la conception assistée par ordinateur du concept final (CAO) et à effectuer la mise en plan (DAO) (si nécessaire) et à apporter un support à la fabrication. L'ingénieur mécanique aura à conseiller sur le choix de composants standard, la sélection de matériaux et de méthodes de fabrication.
Compétences requises
BAC en génie mécanique, en génie aérospatial ou domaines connexes.
5 ans ou plus d’expérience pertinente à l’emploi.
Membre de l'Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec, ou disponible à le devenir.
Bonne connaissance de Solidworks.
Connaissance de Catia V5 (un atout).
Bonne connaissance de la suite MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Bon esprit mécanique.
Expérience dans le domaine de l'aéronautique (un atout).
Expérience dans le domaine de la transformation du bois (un atout).
Expérience dans les outils de levage (un atout).
Bilinguisme (un atout).
Environnement de travail
Salaire concurrentiel.
Régime d'assurances collectives.
Horaire flexible.
Activités sociales variées.
La durée du contrat : 6 mois
Type d'emploi : Temps Plein, Contractuel
Salaire : 18,00$ à 37,00$ par heure
Avantages :
Assurance Invalidité
Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
Assurance Vie
Assurance Vision
Horaires flexibles
Stationnement sur place
Horaire :
8 Heures
Formation:
DEC (Souhaité)
Télétravail:
Non

Title: Field Engineer - Food & Beverage - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
This position provides detailed and highly professional technical assistance and support to the Food & Beverage Group and aids in any engineering technology development projects related to chemical handling/dilution/safety. This position is accountable for all aspects of Food Group equipment and engineering related issues.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Start-up and commissioning activities whether installed by our employees or via installation partners
Checking the performance of projects relative to performance goals.
Initiates and co-ordinates corrective actions in case of not acceptable performance or other issues.
Ensure all documentation, list of spare parts, drawings, etc., are according to contractual agreements, customer expectations, internal expectations and legal requirements.
Train customer employees according to contractual agreements.
Train internal colleagues (service and sales) in order to guarantee appropriate maintenance and issues solving.
Support sales colleagues in collection of customer requirements, develop solutions to customer objectives.
Prepare quotations and support sales when necessary in the presentation of the quotations to and the discussions with the customer.
Execution of successful projects in a timely manner and within budget.
Collaborates with Food & Beverage NA and Global Engineering Teams
Ensures that all local legislation and Health & Safety requirements are fully adhered to during the project execution
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
College Degree in Engineering (preferably in mechanical, chemical, food, or another related field)
Professional Engineer (P.Eng.)
3+ years of experience in the Food & Beverage Engineering
Willingness to travel 50%+/-
Word/Excel/Powerpoint / collaborative applications
Must have valid drivers license in good standing
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience in Technical projects sales (proposals edition, presentation and closing)
Experience with CAD
Engineering project management experience an asset, preferably in food and beverage environment
Experience working with professional services / 3rd parties an asset
Experience with PLC’s an asset, familiar with ladder logic (desirable, not excluding)
Demonstrated ability to prioritize
Problem solving attitude, troubleshooting skills
Professional communication skills – Should be able to communicate with peers, customers and vendors both via verbal and written communication
Technical Communication Skills - Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts, findings & recommendations to senior leadership
Ability to work cross-functionally with teams to balance solutions in accordance with budget, schedule and tools
Ability to work in a fast paced environment – Should be able to multi-task with proven follow-through and adherence to changing priorities and deadlines
Collaborative team player - Should be able to establish solid working relationships with stakeholders
Diversey is committed to providing equal opportunities to all candidates and to meeting the needs of people with disabilities. Should you be contacted regarding an employment opportunity and require an accommodation for a disability, we will be pleased to work with you to identify how we can best support you through this process.

Title: Site Engineer - Lévis, QC - Indeed.com
Mechanical Engineer - St. John's, NL - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description
Founded in 1934, Parker Drilling provides advanced drilling solutions to the energy industry. We are a technically innovative company providing worldwide drilling services, rental tools and project management, including rig design, construction and operations management.
Job Description
This position takes total ownership of projects as assigned by providing mechanical support and expertise. Support includes, but is not limited to, engineering, design, upgrades, rig modifications, and equipment specifications.
Essential functions
Demonstrates proactive and positive client engagement.
Interface with existing and new customers and vendors.
Provide requested updates in a timely manner to all functional groups within the Parker Drilling Canada location.
Review engineering and design documentation.
Create document(s) to support Technical Service Requests (TSR's) and other projects.
Review and comment on engineering and design document(s) for Technical Service Requests (TSR's) and projects.
Support project controls related to engineering.
Support engineering design of existing equipment modification projects and new items as per request from Operations.
Familiar with 3D Modelling and Drafting as required on a project by project basis
Writing technical specifications and procedures.
Maintain and retain complete and accurate business records in accordance with company policies and relevant external audit bodies, as required
Ongoing commissioning and troubleshooting support for rig upgrade projects.
Performs additional duties, responsibilities, and special projects as may be directed.
Additional functions
N/A
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities expected for this position.
Must be able to prioritize jobs and work under tight time constraints.
Must have excellent computer skills to include all MS Office products, analytical software, and computer-aided software
Must be able to find solutions to business problems through Operations and Quality initiatives
Must be able to effectively interface with other departments and divisions to resolve problems
Must have ability to maintain high standards of confidentiality, accuracy and timeliness
Must be a detail oriented, self-starter and able to work with little supervision while maintaining quality
Must possess sound reasoning skills and have the ability to follow directions
Must have the ability to travel to company locations including offshore and remote locations
The ability to read, write, and speak English is required
Knowledge of engineering deliverables such as datasheets, material specifications, material requisitions, scope of work, and data registers.
Proficient drilling knowledge related to drilling equipment, structures, well control, and process/utility systems.
Additional qualifications, skills and abilities
oCandidates require a degree in Engineering from a recognized post-secondary institution. oMust be registered, or eligible for registration, with the Professional Engineers & Geoscientists of Newfoundland and LabradoroAt least 10 years of work experience in the oil and gas industryoMust be able to obtain appropriate offshore certifications:Basic Survival Training (BST)Hydrogen Sulphide (H2S)Installation Safety InductionRegulatory AwarenessWorkplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS)The employee will be required to meet all standards required for safe operations, including but not limited to the standards set forth in the Canadian Association of Petroleum Producers Atlantic Canada Medical Assessment for Fitness to Work Offshore as well as any other standards set forth by regulatory bodies having jurisdiction over the operations.
Position competencies
Intercultural Awareness
Understands, leverages and respects cultural differences, languages, customs and manners on the ground. Has the ability to be flexible, adaptable and agile in foreign environments.
Business Acumen
Business Acumen is understanding how our businesses generate profits and competitive advantage after weighing foreseeable risks. It requires knowledge of how technical and functional roles contribute to and impact bottom-line results. Specifically, it's knowing what business, financial and operational conditions must exist for Parker to maximize profits, without undue risk. Business acumen requires savviness of market practices and industry tactics to assess and determine when the outcome of a decision will result in added value for the organization.
Building Effective Teams
Promotes followership; encourages team members to share knowledge; values contributions of all teammates; shares wins and successes; creates positive morale and spirit.
Physical demands and work environment
Oversee and manage the overall quality of projects and/or employee performance.
Ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data.
Lift, carry, and move objects of up to 50 pounds.
N/A - Not Applicable
Wear personal protective equipment, including but not limited to hard hat, steel-toed safety shoes, hearing protection, respirators, safety glasses, goggles and full body harness.
Ability to ascend and descend ladders, stairs, scaffolding, and/or ramps while carrying tools requiring a reasonable degree of physical stamina and agility and involving moderate to severe physical exertion
Ability to multitask, work in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines, reason logically, and make sound decisions.
Ability to comprehend, remember, and follow verbal and written directions and comply with Company policies, procedures and standard.
Sit/stand while performing primarily sedentary work
Use repetitive wrist, hand or finger movements at a computer.
Ability to work as a team, communicate and interact with others in a professional manner, and consider alternative and diverse perspectives.
Additional Information
Consistent with the Accords Act, residents of Newfoundland and Labrador specifically and Canada generally, who are qualified, will be given first consideration for employment.
Parker Drilling provides equal opportunity for all people and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, genetic information, military service, veteran’s status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
If an applicant has a disability, the applicant may request accommodations when needed to enable that person to perform their essential job functions or to allow that person to participate in employment.
